epd_metadata.address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia
epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.product_use: Concrete is prepared by mixing cement, coarse and fine aggregates, and water, with or without auxiliary agents and additives. Used for foundations, driveways, footpaths, high-rise buildings, dams, spillways, roads, bridges, public works infrastructure, and decorative applications.

product_classes.normal_class: Designed for everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways and footpaths.
product_classes.special_class: Supplied to major construction projects including high strength/performance concrete, high durability, marine application, post-tensioned, high-pumpability, super workable, piling concrete, architectural off-form finishes and decorative applications.

product_description.hazardous_substances: None of the products contain substances listed in the Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern for authorisation.
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging.

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options (modules A4-A5), modules C1-C4 and module D
lca_information.reference_service_life: Not specified; scope is cradle to delivery

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight at quarry and m³ of concrete at batching plant; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to/from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered via trucks and ships without packaging

data_quality.geographic_representativeness: Good or very good for all data sources
data_quality.temporal_representativeness: All data updated within 10 years as required by PCR 2019:14

system_boundaries.upstream_processes: Raw material extraction, transport, manufacturing, and electricity generation for A1 and A3
system_boundaries.core_processes: External and internal transport, manufacturing of concrete (excluding mixing), treatment of waste and wastewater
system_boundaries.downstream_processes: Distribution, installation, construction waste, transport and treatment of waste at end of life
system_boundaries.excluded_lifecycle_stages: Material emissions from usage, maintenance, repair, replacement, refurbishment, operational energy and water use

installation.operational_control: No operational control by Holcim; assumptions based on industrial expertise and GCCA tool
installation.activities: Pouring concrete from truck and pump, manual finishing; excludes pre-installation activities

deconstruction.method: Physical process of drilling and removing concrete using hydraulic excavator

end_of_life.notes: Holcim has no control over end-of-life fate; assumptions based on common scenarios and National Waste Report 2022

carbon_emission_context.carbonation_note: CO2 absorption by concrete over lifetime (carbonation) not considered in this EPD

allocation_method.fly_ash: Treated as waste material; only transport impacts included
allocation_method.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Allocated economically due to significant economic value
allocation_method.silica_fume: Treated as waste material; only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.recycled_aggregate_use: Recycled aggregate can replace virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements

additional_info.product_safety: Classified as Non-Dangerous Goods according to Australian Code for Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail

impact_categories: Abiotic depletion potential (elements and fossil fuels)
Use of renewable and non-renewable primary energy
Use of secondary materials and fuels
Materials for recycling and energy recovery
Additional Green Star indicators (Human toxicity, Land use, Ionising radiation, Particulate matter, Water scarcity index)
disclaimers: Some impact indicators have high uncertainties or limited experience
Ionising radiation indicator excludes nuclear accidents, occupational exposure, and radioactive waste disposal effects
GWP-GHG (IPCC AR5) excludes biogenic carbon and indirect radiative forcing
